newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican stocks end lower in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: Mexican stocks end lower in quiet trading.

text.p: Mexican stocks closed slightly lower Friday, after the bulk of the day's losses were erased by a recovery in U.S. blue-chips and late buying ahead of the close of the month.
"The market tended to recover towards the close, due to (portfolio) valuations that need to be made at the close of the month and the quarter," said one trader.
"Also, the Dow turned around and that obviously helped."
The blue chip IPC index fell 2.74 points to 3,236.79, compared to a session low of 3,203.17. Volume was sluggish at 60.3 million shares.
"With the low volume we had it could easily have fallen through, but the rebound was at low volume and there are no indications of a change in downtrend," said a technical analyst.

Lagging stocks and selective speculative buying stood out in a session otherwise marked by low volume. The percentage gainers list was led by video rentals stock Video nominal series shares, which gained 2.10 pesos (28 cents) to 14.89 pesos ($1.97), and are not frequently traded.
In second place was financial group Abaco B series, which gained 26 centavos (3 cents) to 2.74 pesos (36 cents), which traders put down to speculation that its banking division would raise capital.
Other gainers were traded at very low volume.
On the broad market, of a total of 107 stocks traded, gainers outnumbered losers 44 to 43, with the remaining 20 unchnaged.
